MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters. This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. Here is the code of init_response_body_data: ```c static int init_response_body_data (void) { if (0 != body_dyn_size) { body_dyn = (char *) malloc (body_dyn_size); if (NULL == body_dyn) { fprintf (stderr, "Failed to allocate memory.\n"); return 0; } if (tool_params.medium) { /* Fill the body with HTML-like content */ size_t pos; size_t filler_pos; static const char body_header[] = "\n" "\nSample page title\n\n" "\n"; static const char body_filler[] = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
\n"; static const char body_footer[] = "\n" "\n"; pos = 0; memcpy (body_dyn + pos, body_header, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header)); pos += MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header); for (filler_pos = 0; filler_pos < (body_dyn_size - (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_header) + MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer))); ++filler_pos) { body_dyn[pos + filler_pos] = body_filler[filler_pos % MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_filler)]; } pos += filler_pos; memcpy (body_dyn + pos, body_footer, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (body_footer)); } else { /* Fill the body with binary-like content */ size_t pos; for (pos = 0; pos < body_dyn_size; ++pos) { body_dyn[pos] = (char) (unsigned char) (255U - pos % 256U); } } } return ! 0; } ``` Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze: ```c pos += filler_pos; ``` Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
scenario: Yes. If body_dyn_size is smaller than the sum of the header and footer lengths, the expression used as the loop bound (body_dyn_size - (MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(body_header) + MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(body_footer))) will underflow (size_t), causing the filler loop to iterate far more times than intended. After the loop pos is incremented by filler_pos (pos += filler_pos) and later used as the destination for memcpy(body_dyn + pos, body_footer, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(body_footer)). In that underflow case memcpy will write beyond the allocated body_dyn buffer, violating MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
